Phase 2 - Data Processing

MMQGIS plugin was used to generate the points for primary and secondary schools from the csv file obtained from data.gov.sg. The population data was then cleaned and joined using QGIS DB Manager.

The livability of a location depends on various factors that are crucial to an individualâ€™s growth, physical and mental wellbeing. Such factors include ease of connectivity, availability of education, healthcare, and food. Therefore, eleven factors were chosen as points of interest to be analyzed and they are listed in the table below. Each factor was clipped using the 600-meter Service Area from the MRT Station Exits.

After clipping all the individual factors, save them in a GeoPackage â€œfile nameâ€ with the correct projection of â€œEPSG:3414 â€“ SVY21 / Singapore TMâ€.

Creating Exits/Entry point

Since the newly TEL stage 4 does not have an exit/entry point layer, manual creation is required with reference to Land Transport Authorityâ€™s (LTA) design plan as shown in the figures below:



One approach is to create a â€œNew Temporary Scratch Layerâ€. Firstly, on the menu bar, click on Layer >>> Create Layer >>> New Temporary Scratch Layer.

A new pop-up screen will be shown. Rename the layer name according to the naming convention of â€œstation name_ Station_exitsâ€. Then, change the geometry type to Points as well as the projection system as shown below. Leave the rest as default and click on OK.

A temporary new layer will be added in the Layers tab. On the menu bar select Toggle edit button and select Add Points.

Navigate to the FM station and click on the station and a point should be created as shown below. This approach would allow us to create the station exits/entry for all 8 stations.

Shortest Distance

Analysed the amenities and points of interest within 10-minutesâ€™ walk from each of the stations for Stage 4. With the extracted walking path layer as mentioned above, network analysis of the Shortest Path (point to layer) has been used to calculate the shortest distance for the 8 stationâ€™s exits/entry points.
